clinical_study.brief_title: Physiological Effects of Expiration With the Glottis Open in Lateral Posture (ELTGOL) and Flutter Valve in Patients With Bronchiectasis
clinical_study.official_title: Acute Physiological Effects of Expiration With the Glottis Open in Lateral Posture (ELTGOL) and Flutter Valve in Dynamic and Static Pulmonary Volumes of Patients With Bronchiectasis

lead_sponsor.agency: Universidade Federal do Rio de Janeiro

clinical_study.source: Universidade Federal do Rio de Janeiro

brief_summary.textblock: This study aimed to evaluate the acute physiological effects of expiration with the glottis open in lateral posture (ELTGOL) and Flutter valve in dynamic and static lung volumes in patients with bronchiectasis and, secondarily, to study the effect of these techniques in sputum production.

primary_outcome.time_frame: In the week 1, 2 and 3. Before (baseline) and after each intervention.
primary_outcome.description: Dynamic and static lung volumes were assessed by forced spirometry and plethysmography.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Sputum was colected during the interventions
secondary_outcome.description: The expectorated secretions were collected using a sputum trap and quantificated by its dry weight.

intervention.description: Flutter valve is a physiotherapy device commonly used for the treatment of pulmonary hypersecretive conditions. The patients is taught to exhale through the device, producing positive expiratory pressure and flow oscillations. In this study the intervention took 15 minutes. During this period the patients were free to cough.

intervention.intervention_name: expiration with the glottis open in lateral posture (ELTGOL)
intervention.description: This technique is a maneuver of slow expiration with the glottis open, with the subject in lateral posture. The patients performed three sets of 10 repetitions in left and right lateral decubitus.
Patients were instructed to stay comfortably seated during 15 minutes. After this period they were stimulated to cough during a five minutes period.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Patients with clinical and radiological criteria of bronchiectasis
Exclusion Criteria:
- heart failure
- pneumonia
- chest pain
- inability to perform the procedures
- asthma
- cystic fibrosis
